Javins v. First Nat\u2019l Realty Corp.,.raw_text: Javins v. First Nat’l Realty Corp., 428 F.2d 1071 (D.C. Cir. 1970)
Javins v. First Nat\u2019l Realty Corp.,.proposition: The covenant is breached where the landlord’s acts or omissions substantially interfere with the tenant’s beneficial use and enjoyment of the premises, including by failing to remedy serious defects that render the premises unfit for their intended residential use.

Hilder v. St. Peter, 478 A.2d 203 (Vt. 1.proposition: (Representative Massachusetts statutory and regulatory provisions and leading authorities that relate to landlord obligations, habitability, and the covenant of quiet enjoyment; Plaintiff relies upon these authorities as support for the legal standards governing the covenant and landlord duties.)

Massachusetts Sanitary Code, 105 CMR 410.raw_text: Massachusetts Sanitary Code, 105 CMR 410.000 et seq. (Minimum Standards of Fitness for Human Habitation)
Massachusetts Sanitary Code, 105 CMR 410.proposition: Massachusetts statutory and regulatory law supports the obligation of landlords to provide premises fit for human habitation and free from hazardous or unsanitary conditions.
